body.bodyPara: A world news article serves a specific purpose in a newspaper. These articles are written to inform the audience of events that are going on and that the audience has an interest in. News networks and journals today are extremely detailed and in-depth, covering relevant news from all over the World. CNN, one of the most accredited and widely recognized news channels has adopted different genres when responding to global news in the past compared to today. In this essay I will be looking at the various differences in genre between the year 2000, and the present, 2016. These differences in genre will be explored with regards to language used to evaluate a situation (between two news articles published in different years). I will also be discussing the uptakes between the two genres of the news articles

The focus on the first news journal is on US news as global news and exposure to global events wasn’t as essential to the US population as news regarding their own country. The main body section has news about Bill Clinton, Hillary Clinton and Al Gore. The focus is much more political. The small ‘Other News’ section on the right has brief summaries on current affairs in other parts of the World.

In the 2016 CNN article, the breaking news is about Hurricane Matthew which is damaging the environment and threatening lives in countries in the Caribbean. As it is seen, it is international news which is in the front page rather than local news. The section on the left has an equal amount of US and global news, suggesting that there is a shift in genre toward current global current events.

report.p: Good introduction in general. From what I understood, the essay focuses on two different genres relating to news articles, one focused in the past and on win the present. In my opinion, I think you should make your thesis statement more detailed to mention the complete overview of what you are going to write. Also, mentioning the uptakes that will be discussed might also help with guiding your essay in a more flow-like manner. The essay seems to be going on the direction of solving the prompt mentioned during class. However, starting the main argument in a more clear way would be more affective because I don't seem to be able to locate it. You should also add tags to help guide the reader/reviewer. One thing you can also improve in is mentioning what the genre actually is to help the people who are reading it for the first time understand what the essay’s about.
